questions.text: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since the 10th century.
The Pacific Ocean covers about 63 million square miles, more than all land areas combined.

questions.text: What year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September.

questions.text: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first U.S. President from 1789 to 1797.

questions.text: Which ancient civilization built the pyramids of Giza?
questions.explanation: The ancient Egyptians built the Giza pyramids around 2560 BCE as tombs for pharaohs.
The Renaissance was a cultural movement from the 14th-17th centuries emphasizing art, science, and humanism.

questions.text: Which country has the largest population?
questions.explanation: India surpassed China in 2023 to become the world's most populous country with over 1.4 billion people.

questions.text: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is approximately 6,650 km long, though some argue the Amazon may be longer.

questions.text: What treaty ended World War I?
questions.explanation: The Treaty of Versailles, signed in 1919, officially ended WWI and imposed harsh terms on Germany.
Plato wrote The Republic around 375 BCE, discussing justice and the ideal state.
